arm_group.description: Patients using the RT-CGM for the intervention portion of the study.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will investigate whether real-time continuous glucose monitoring can be used as a
      tool for behavior change in people with pre-diabetes.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Real Time Continuous Glucose Monitoring in Subjects With Pre-diabetes

detailed_description.textblock:
The protocol is a prospective, non-blinded, randomized controlled study in persons with
      newly diagnosed pre-diabetes comparing the effects of real-time continuous glucose
      monitoring (RT-CGM) combined with diet and lifestyle education to those who have diet and
      lifestyle education alone.  During a "wash-in" phase both groups will wear a masked CGM for
      1 week at baseline and again after 12 weeks. Those randomized to the RT-CGM will wear it for
      4 cycles of 2 week on/1 week off over the next 12 weeks. Both groups will follow-up with
      their primary care providers as clinically indicated over the next year with quarterly
      measurements of blood pressure, weight, and BMI.  At the end of this period, they will wear
      a masked CGM for 1 week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 or older

          -  Newly diagnosed with pre-diabetes (within the previous 6 months) with a FPG of > or =
             110-125mg/dl or an A1c > or = 6% - 6.4%

          -  Able to independently measure and read finger stick blood glucose levels

          -  Willing to wear the CGM device for up to 12 weeks during the study period

          -  Willing to test blood sugar by fingerstick twice per day while wearing the CGM

          -  DEERS eligible

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Using medication for pre-diabetes

          -  Women who are pregnant, lactating, planning to become pregnant, or without a safe
             contraceptive method; all female subjects will undergo pregnancy testing via a serum
             HcG with their initial blood testing.

          -  Subjects who are taking glucocorticoids, amphetamines, anabolic, or weight-reducing
             agents during the course of the study.

          -  Active Duty service members likely to be deployed during the 18-month study period.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating the impact of lifestyle changes on levels of glycemic control in the control and experimental groups.

Objective comparison between the control and experimental group in changes in blood pressure.
Objective comparison between the control group and the experimental group on changes in lipids.
Objective comparison between the control group and the experimental group on changes in weight.
An objective comparison between the control and experimental group on changes in medication use.
